title: Potato and Watercress Salad
introduction: Potato and Watercress Salad offers a delightful blend of creamy and tangy flavors contrasted with the slightly peppery taste of watercress. This unique salad derives its distinctiveness from a yogurt and olive oil dressing that is enhanced with fresh horseradish. Originating from the Trentino–Alto Adige region in northern Italy, this dish perfectly combines traditional ingredients for a fresh and innovative salad experience.
ingredients: 1 1⁄2 pounds Yukon gold or other waxy boiling potatoes
2 tablespoons peeled and minced fresh horseradish or drained bottled horseradish
Freshly ground black pepper to taste
1 large bunch watercress, tough stems removed (about 4 cups)
instructions: 1. Place the potatoes in a medium saucepan with cold water to cover and salt to taste. Bring to a simmer and cook until the potatoes are tender when pierced with a knife, about 20 minutes. Drain and let cool slightly. Peel the potatoes and cut into 1⁄4-inch thick slices.
2. In a medium bowl, whisk together the yogurt, oil, horseradish, and salt and pepper to taste until smooth and well blended.
3. Add the potatoes and watercress to the bowl and mix well. Taste and adjust seasoning. Serve immediately or cover and chill in the refrigerator up to 3 hours.
